p.span: Your child'sÂ distance learning packet will be available for pick-up on Tuesday, April 7thÂ

div.p: Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â 1927 E Walnut, Shawnee, OK 74801 405-275-6092 Fax 405-275-6094

p.br:
March 19, 2020
Dear Parents and Guardians,
State officials have ordered â€œall accredited public schools to cease operations effective March 17th until April 6th. Cessation of operations includes all instructional services, grading, all extra-curricular activities, staff development, training, or conferences." This effort is to slow the spread of the pandemic COVID-19 virus in our state. We agree with State officials that the safety of our students, staff, and families should be the primary focus.
To provide services to our student community, we are developing a plan to provide meals for drive-by pick-up at the school beginning March 23, 2020, from 10:30-11:30 AM Monday thru Friday. This information will be posted on our district website, Facebook page and through our robo-call system.
If you havenâ€™t been contacted by your childâ€™s teacher and would like to receive meals, please contact us at 405-275-6092 Monday at 8:30 or contact your childâ€™s teacher. Provide your name, contact number and total in household 18 and under. We understand that you may be a caretaker for individuals that are not typically our students; they will count, too.
Remember, Pleasant Grove Public School will remain closed until April 6, 2020. We will continue to provide updated information regarding school closure.

div.p: The Tobacco Settlement Endowment Trust (TSET) recognized Pleasant Grove Public School on Friday for their efforts to encourage healthy behaviors in students, faculty, and staff.
(click on the photo above to read article)

div.style: background: rgb(9, 155, 221); padding: 0in; border: 3pt solid rgb(9, 155, 221); border-image: none;

span.strong: Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â 4th - 8thÂ School Supply ListÂ
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â

span.span: CONGRATULATIONS to Scott Roper of Pottawatomie County and Pleasant Grove Schools for being named the 2018 Neil Hann Award recipient for Leadership, Innovation & Inspiration!

Mr. Roper will be recognized at a special awards luncheon during the Turning Point Conference on Thursday, August 30th at the Moore Norman Technology Center South Penn Campus, 13301 S. Penn Ave., Oklahoma City, OK 73170.

div.p: Pleasant Grove Public School, would like to thank Chris Simpson and Perfection Graphics in Oklahoma City for donating the decals for their new bus purchased with the Â½ cent sales tax funds. This bus will provide more opportunities for more students to attend field trips and local events. Again, Thank You Chris Simpson and Perfection Graphics.

p.strong: in Shawnee, Pottawatomie county and the state of Oklahoma!

div.h4: The healthier we make our community's schools, the healthier our kids will be.Blue Zones ProjectÂ® makes it easy for schools to teach students how to lead longer, happier lives. Schools are already an essential part of helping kids make smart choices about staying healthy. By encouraging better eating habits, implementing tobacco-free policies, and increasing physical activity, schools can use Blue Zones Project to help students and parents form healthy habits for life.

p.font: Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â

span.span: Pleasant Grove Public School is excited to announce the use of our new BlackBoard Connect system. The BlackBoard system will allow us to instantly contact parents in case of weather related closings, schoolwide announcements, events or emergency situations. We have the ability to use phone calls, text messages, emails and social media updates to assist keeping our district safe and informed!
Of the 34 federally recognized Native American tribes in Oklahoma,

p.span: Schools is proud to recognize a third of those tribes as members of our school.Â We are proud of the influence that those students bring and the traditions that we can carry on in the history of these tribes. Click here to view the information on our Native American students.

span.span: Pleasant Grove Public School is working hard to implement the new Oklahoma Academic Standards focused on preparing students for College, Careers and Citizenship. This includes the Common Core State Standards (CCSS), adopted in 2010, for English language arts and mathematics for grades PreKâ€12. Oklahoma AcademicÂ StandardsÂ serve as expectations for what students should know and be able to do by the end of the school year. The development, review and revision process involves stakeholders throughout the state of Oklahoma and is an ongoing and critical component to ensure Oklahoma students in every classroom receive current and relevant learning experiences. Click on the banner to learn more.

p.span: At Pleasant Grove Public School, we work together to provide a safe learning environment where all students master goals through discovery and personalized learning.
Pleasant Grove Public School shall inspire students to take responsibility for their choices and empower them to become creative, confident, and productive citizens.
We always like to recognize our students and staff for a job well done. Click here to see the pictures and read about the great things going on at Pleasant Grove Schools.

span.span: lahoma State Department of Education grades schools yearly on theirÂ performance in all areas of student learningÂ andÂ teacher performance.Â Â At Pleasant Grove, we are proud of our results each school year in all areas ofÂ studentÂ achievement.Â You may click here to view any of Pleasant Grove Public School's District & Site Report Cards.
